title: Set up GitHub OAuth app and auth flow
description: Register a GitHub OAuth App. Build the auth flow: redirect to GitHub, handle callback, store token in session/localStorage. Gate /manage behind auth. This is the foundation — nothing else works without it.

title: Scaffold /manage SPA and Netlify routing
description: Create static/manage/ directory with index.html. Configure Netlify _redirects or netlify.toml so /manage serves the SPA. Verify it deploys alongside the Zola site without interfering with existing routes.

title: Add visual editor for blog posts
description: Web-based visual editor for blog posts, served at /manage on the same Netlify deployment. Static SPA using GitHub OAuth for auth and GitHub Contents API for read/write. Each save = git commit (already on remote), push = live via Netlify. Markdown editor with structured TOML frontmatter fields. Supports per-page custom CSS/JS fields. No backend server, no database — just a static app talking to GitHub API.
